definition:
Let $A$ be a square matrix of order $n$ with entries $a_{ij}$ which are
real or complex. Then $A$ is said to be *diagonally dominant* if
$$|a_{ii}| \geq \sum^n_{j=1, j\neq i} |a_{ij}|$$ for $i$ from $1$ to
$n$.\
In addition $A$ is said to be *strictly diagonally dominant* if
$$|a_{ii}| > \sum^n_{j=1, j\neq i}|a_{ij}|$$ for $i$ from $1$ to $n$.\
